intro: Coccoloba nervosa, commonly known as the velvetleaf or coral tree, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its striking, palmate leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety texture. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It is native to the Americas, ranging from the southern United States to South America. Coccoloba nervosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
